title: How to Make a Waffle BLT

steps.headline: Pick out your waffles.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Pick up bacon, a fresh head of lettuce (your choice) and a ripened tomato.
steps.description: Consider getting all the ingredients from the market, ready to cook or slice.

steps.headline: Select a dressing such as mayo, mustard and/or your own “special secret sauce.”
Cook the bacon.
Cut lettuce for your sandwich.
steps.description: Consider tearing the leaves into small pieces so you end up with bite-sized chunks instead of big leaves.

steps.headline: Slice the tomato.
steps.description: Depending on the way you like your BLT, cut thick slices especially if this is a ripe, juicy tomato.

steps.headline: Prep your sauce.
steps.description: Consider putting the sauce on the side of the plate so you can either apply at some point or you could even slather it on the side of your sandwich.

steps.headline: Cook the waffle(s).
steps.description:
If you are making your own waffle from scratch and using a waffle iron, making one waffle per sandwich will work well. However frozen waffles (unless you found frozen Belgium waffles) may require two to make the sandwich. text:
Picking Out Ingredients Pick out your waffles. You can approach this task a few ways. You could head to the frozen aisle at your grocer or you could make your own waffles from scratch using a waffle iron and your own recipe. If you choose to use frozen waffles go for the best brand you can find. Look for ones that are light and fluffy; sans chocolate chips or any other dressings. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pick up bacon, a fresh head of lettuce (your choice) and a ripened tomato. Consider getting all the ingredients from the market, ready to cook or slice. Select a dressing such as mayo, mustard and/or your own “special secret sauce.” Making Your Sandwich Cook the bacon. Only use the number of bacon pieces you plan to add to your sandwich. Perhaps two or three will do the job. Cook bacon until crispy but not burned. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Drain cooked bacon on a paper towel or an iron rack that is supported by a pan (so the grease drips below). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut lettuce for your sandwich. Consider tearing the leaves into small pieces so you end up with bite-sized chunks instead of big leaves. Slice the tomato. Depending on the way you like your BLT, cut thick slices especially if this is a ripe, juicy tomato. Prep your sauce. Consider putting the sauce on the side of the plate so you can either apply at some point or you could even slather it on the side of your sandwich. Cook the waffle(s). If you are making your own waffle from scratch and using a waffle iron, making one waffle per sandwich will work well. However frozen waffles (unless you found frozen Belgium waffles) may require two to make the sandwich. Slice the homemade waffle into two pieces once it’s cooled. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Waffle-BLT-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

"} Stack the bacon, lettuce and tomato onto the sliced waffle (or single waffle). Make sure you alternate between the bacon and tomato slices with a bit of lettuce. Add the top, spoon the sauce on the side and attack!
